description: A stocky magnifier.  Mounts behind a red dot or holographic sight, allowing it to be used at longer ranges.  The main disadvantage of magnifiers is their weight and bulk.

variants.description: This compact sight attaches in front of a present red dot or holographic sight, magnifying the sight picture by a factor of 3.  This allows you to aim at a further distance reliably, without changing sights.  The main disadvantage of a magnifier is the weight it adds to a firearm, making it that much less ergonomic.  <variant_black>

description: A bulky magnifier.  Mounts behind a red dot or holographic sight, allowing it to be used at longer ranges.  The main disadvantage of magnifiers is their weight and bulk.

variants.description: This bulky sight attaches in front of a present reflex sight, magnifying the sight picture by a factor of 3.  This allows you to aim at a further distance reliably, without changing sights.  The main disadvantage of a magnifier is the weight it adds to a firearm, making it that much less ergonomic.  <variant_black>

notes: height assumed to be absolute co-witness height (1.46 in.) × 1.2

description: A compact magnifier.  Mounts behind a red dot or holographic sight, allowing it to be used at longer ranges.  The main disadvantage of magnifiers is their weight and bulk.

variants.description: This somewhat-compact sight attaches in front of a present reflex sight, magnifying the sight picture by a factor of 3.  This allows you to aim at a further distance reliably, without changing sights.  The main disadvantage of a magnifier is the weight it adds to a firearm, making it that much less ergonomic.  <variant_black>

notes: height assumed to be absolute co-witness height (1.46 in.) × 1.2
